entry.title: UI5 MCP Server Got Extended for UI Integration Cards Generation
entry.content:
Following recent announcement for the release and availability of the UI5 MCP server, we are pleased to announce that the UI5 MCP Server now supports the development of Integration Cards. In its latest version â€“ v0.2.1 â€“ it includes three new tools dedicated to Integration Cards. These tools assist Large Language Models (LLMs) in creating new Integration Cards from scratch or editing existing ones, following the best practices for card development.

Infuse Creativity Into Your Integration Cards

The updated UI5 MCP Server version v.0.2.1 enhances card development with AI Agents like Cline. Fostering creativity and efficiency, this approach makes it easy for both developers and non-developers to create Integration Cards smoothly.

Usage of the UI5 MCP Server in Cline.

 

Why Use the UI5 MCP Server for Integration Cards Development?

The reasons for initially using UI5 MCP Server are similarly applicable to developing Integration Cards:

  • LLMs might lack information on the latest best practices and APIs recommended for Integration Cards development.
  • LLMs might suggest using the properties of Integration Cards or APIs that are not available in your project's version or have been marked as deprecated.
  • Scaffolding can help agents kickstart new projects faster and with established patterns, saving token costs.

and furthermore:

  • Encouraging the use of cards of type Declarative to make the card also compatible with Mobile Native platforms.
  • Providing specific knowledge for each card type to the LLMs, such as the available chart types in Analytical cards, and enabling the LLMs to suggest the best chart type for your data.
  • And moreâ€¦

Tools

  1. Best practice guidance for your agent: get_integration_cards_guidelines
  2. Scaffolding a new Integration Card: create_integration_card
  3. Validating the Cardâ€™s manifest: run_manifest_validation

Setup & Use 

Install the UI5 MCP Server v.0.2.1 in your AI agent, as described here. Once this version or later is installed, your AI Agent should automatically gain access to the new tools. Once you define your prompt for generating a Card the AI Agent will offer you as first step to run the get_integration_cards_guidelines, then will scaffold the very coding project with dynamically created Card, and finally will run the manifest schema validation tool. Enjoy your Card! 

Whatâ€™s Next?

We plan to further enhance the existing tools to handle more complex scenarios, such as creating or editing child cards, pagination in list and table cards, a more advanced configuration editor for the generated card, and more.

entry.title: S/4HANA 2025 FPS0 Fully-Activated Appliance custom installation
entry.content:
This blog covers installation of (1) SAP S/4HANA server and (2) SAP NW JAVA / ADS server as shown in the graphic below. The installation is based on file restore and is different from the standard installs using SWPM.

Please refer to S/4HANA SQUARE ONE for other blogs

In this blog the procedure is simplified for hostname change and SID change. Also if you want to change instance number the command, screens show where you can change the instance number. This would make sense if your network cannot accommodate the unique hostname and SID. Also if it is a more permanent installation you may like to change SID and hostname.

If you want to do standard installation with no change in hostname and sid please refer to other blog In this blog the procedure is simplified for standard installation with NO HOSTNAME OR SID CHANGE. The advantage with this is that you don't have to do many of the steps related to SID change and it does make sense if you will be installing the instance temporarily.

This blog is based on a fresh installation of SUSE Linux for SAP OS without having any previous SAP instances created and deleted. I did not have to pre install hostagent, etc. There are mount points/links to be setup as shown in the right place in the directory structure. The steps in the guides provided with SAP Note 2041140 could be used as a reference in case there are issues specific to your environment. Just follow the steps below to install both systems shown in red square below:

Please find below the main note for ordering the appliance:
2041140 - Order an SAP pre-assembled Best Practices software appliance (as partner or customer)

PART1: SOFTWARE DOWNLOAD

Please download the software media from https://me.sap.com/softwarecenter
INSTALLATIONS & UPGRADES => By Alphabetical Index (A-Z) => S => SAP S/4HANA => SAP S/4HANA 2025 => S/4HANA FULLY-ACTIVATED APPLIANCE => SAP S/4HANA 2025 FA APPL

On SAP S/4HANA Server, download the 51059242_1 to 51059242_5  files and SWPM20SP22_5-80003424.SAR (or later).

On SAP NW JAVA / ADS server, download the 51059242_5, SWPM10SP45_4-20009701.SAR and 51050829_JAVA_part 1 & 2 - NW 7.5 Java based SW Comp.

PART2: INSTALL SAP S/4HANA

STEP 1: PREPARE SYSTEM Prepare Linux Server as below for the appliance. The values in Used column below show the minimum size needed. For /sapmnt provide min 30GB, /hana/data space - min 500GB, /hana/log min 120GB. I have used /sapmedia - 200GB temporary separate mount that can be removed later.

Plan the change of SID, hostname, instance number. Please refer to the notes below for reserved SIDs SAP Note 1979280 - Reserved SAP System Identifiers (SAPSID) with Software Provisioning Manager and hostnames SAP Note 611361 - Hostnames of SAP ABAP Platform servers
The table below shows standard SID and hostnames and what we are changing it to.

The /etc/hostname and /etc/host file is below. If you are changing hostname for db and sap add the standard and new hostname for DB but for SAP only provide new hostname. Also for J2E include the new hostname only as this is on separate instance. The standard hostname can be removed later as shown in the steps below. Please note that it has

STEP 2: EXTRACT FILES Extract files 51059242_*  in /sapmedia

sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_1.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_2.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_3.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_4.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_5.ZIP

Allow approx 2 hours for extraction.

We will install Central system with DB and App on same server. Please move all *.tgz-* files (from 51059242_1 to 51059242_4) to /sapmedia/51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1

cd /sapmedia/51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1
mv /sapmedia/51059242_2/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_2/*.tgz-*   .
mv /sapmedia/51059242_3/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_3/*.tgz-*   .
mv /sapmedia/51059242_4/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_4/*.tgz-*   .
mv /sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_5/*.tgz-*   .

In the next step we will extract the above *.tgz files but please note the directories size is as follows so you can provide ample space:

Please use command below to extract the database related archives:

sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia/# cd 51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1

cat dblog.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner -zpxvf - -C /

Similarly extract the remaining files:

cat dbexe.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner -zpxvf - -C /
cat dbdata.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner -zpxvf - -C /

It takes about an hour for extraction.

Below two Application related archives may be extracted on a separate app server for distributed installation. These files will be extracted under /sapmnt/S4H and /usr/sap/S4H so if you are changing the SID, then you will have to first extract to SID-S4H and then create links to your own SID like S4D

Then extract the files:
sid-hdd-s4d:/usr/sap #cd 51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1
cat usrsap_s4h.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner  -zpxvf - -C /
cat sapmnt_s4h.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner  -zpxvf - -C /

STEP 3: GET PASSWORDS Download the file below and open the file in Internet Explorer to note passwords:
/sapmedia/51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_5/SAP_Software_Appliance.xml


Follow this procedure as it is a known issue, please refer SAP Note 2082466 - Known Issues in SAP HANA Platform Lifecycle Management (HDBLCM)  (Issue# 69)

cd /hana/shared/HDB/HDB02/vhcalhdbdb
rm .daemon.ini.swp

vi daemon.ini
Edit section [localsecurestore] to change instances = 0

STEP 4: REGISTER DATABASE 

The HANA DB hdblcm register_rename_system command will rename the filesystem for you according to the new target SID for Hana database instance. HDB => HDD.

Please ensure groupid=1000 is free and groupid=79 are free. Use SAP Note 3686516 for troubleshooting.

Execute HANA database specific steps as below:

sid-hdd-s4d: ##/hana/shared/HDB/hdblcm/hdblcm --action=register_rename_system  --groupid=1000 --lss_groupid=79

TIP: Places where you need to enter data is indicated, rest all are default options. Please note hdblcm now includes rename database host and a separate step with command to rename db host (hdblcm --action=rename_system --hostmap=vhcalhdbdb=vhcalhdddb) is not required. Also a separate step to rename mount points (hdblcm --action=register_rename_system) is not required.

This should bring up the database processes as below

sid-hdd-s4d: #/usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 02 -function GetProcessList

TIP: At this point it is necessary to install the HANA database license as the database will be started in restricted mode.

STEP 5: EXTRACT SWPM Extract SWPM in folder /install. Use the SAPCAR already available to extract.

sid-hdd-s4d:/install #/sapmnt/S4D/exe/uc/linuxx86_64/SAPCAR -xvf /sapmedia/SWPM20SP22_5-80003424.SAR

STEP 6: RENAME SAP SYSTEM Rename instance using sapinst

sid-hdd-s4d:/install # ./sapinst SAPINST_ENFORCE_CRL=false SAPINST_USE_HOSTNAME=vhcals4dci SAPINST_GUI_HOSTNAME=vhcals4dci 

Copy below URL into chrome browser to start sapinst rename process:

https://sid-hdd-s4d.dummy.nodomain:4237/sapinst/docs/index.html

In SAPINST select System Rename => Standard System => SAP System Rename

At screen SAP System Parameters enter Source System S4H and Target System S4D:
Click on Next.

At the screen Prerequisite Checker Results accept or fix the Prerequisite check results.
Click on Next. No if you don't want to repeat the test

At the screen SAP Instance Parameters accept or change the Target System Instance Numbers.
Click on Next.

At the screen SAP HANA Database Connectivity enter Instance Number 02(or changed number) and Password Appliance__1234. Click on Next.

If you don't install HANA DB license you will get error below. Install license using HANA Studio and continue. License is required if there is a database SID change..

At the screen SAP HANA Database Parameter you can change Schema User , DBACOCKPIT and SYSTEM password. Please note it is also optional to change the schema user SAPHANADB password along with DBACOCKPIT and SYSTEM users.

At the screen Database Schema accept schema SAPHANADB password and confirm Schema password Xxxxxxxn click on Next.

At the screen Rename Tenant Database click on Next

At the screen Secure Storage for Database Connection select HANA Secure User tore (hdbuserstore) click on Next 

At the screen Operating System Users accept master password or enter password Xxxxxxxn
At the screen Secure Storage Key Generation accept radio button â€“ Individual Key (Recommended for Productive Systems) On the Next
At next screen Warning click OK
At the screen DNS Domain Name checkmark Set FQDN for SAP System and enter domain name dummy.nodomain Click on Next
At the screen Install License Key keep unchecked Install License Key. Click on Next
TIP: It is much easier to install the license by providing the file than doing it later through the application.
At next screen Cleanup of Encryption Key checkmark on Yes cleanup os users and click on Next
At next screen Cleanup of Operating System Users checkmark on Yes cleanup os users and click on Next
Here is the Parameter Summary Click on Next to confirm and begin the installation.

TIP: In case you get this ERROR:

(1) Error occurs when executing command 'changekey' using the command line tool 'rsecssfx'.

RESOLUTION: Follow SAP Note 2800204 - SSFX-0362: Value file "-" does not start with the UTF-8 byte order mark

Ensure the environment variable LC_CTYPE of the user running sapinst is set as LC_CTYPE=en_US.
Stop the current sapinst and restart it. Continue with the existing option.

(2) You may get Warning below for rename of profile parameter. Found possible references to the source system in the profile directory of the target system /sapmnt/S4D/profile 

After sapinst process is finished you can manually start the SAP instance S4D

sid-hdd-s4d:/install # /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 01 -function StartSystem ALL
sid-hdd-s4d:/install # /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 00 -function StartSystem ALL

After instance is started and confirmed you can delete the sapmedia folder and remove temporary links to S4H as well as temporary hostnames.

Standard users are as follows:
HANA DB â€“ Instance 02 SYSTEM /<Master Password> or as you changed in above
Web Dispatcher access : bpinst/Welcome1

STEP 7: POST STEPS Follow steps from guide attached to SAP Note 2041140 - First Steps for on-premise installations.pdf => Section 5 Technical Post-deployment Activities

Adapt HANA connections in DBACOCKPIT (nothing was required to be done here).

Host name / port in table HTTPURLLOC using tcode httpurlloc

Adapt RFC Connections

ABAP connections:
â€¢ LOCAL_RFC
â€¢ S4DCLNT100, S4DCLNT200, S4DCLNT400
â€¢ S4D_RFC

HTTP connections:
â€¢ ADS (pointing to the JAVA server after PART3: INSTALL SAP NW JAVA /ADS)
â€¢ LOCAL_HTTP
â€¢ LOCAL_HTTPS
â€¢ S4FIN_HTTPS

SAP Enable Now Web Assistant enter tCode /UI2/FLP_CUS_CONF

Adapt the Fiori notification URL. enter tCode /UI2/FLP_SYS_CONF

Adapt Enterprise Search

Apply product license keys

Install software product license key: Technical restrictions may apply if you donâ€™t install the license. Use the link to obtain license key.
HANA DB license key can be installed via HANA Studio (Preferences -> License)
In SAP S/4HANA 1909 the license key is installed via SAP logon tCode SLICENSE

Further post-installation checks

Install SAP client tools on your local computers

You can take a full backup and remove the temporary links that were setup for S4H

In client 000 fix transport configuration. Enter tCode SE06 and reinstall CTS transport system, Change originals to S4D, Delete old TMS config, delete old versions of transport routes

Adapt any SAP parameters due to changed SID

The database should be with log mode overwrite and you may like to change that as needed.Please carry out the the other basis steps that are usually done with SID change/System refresh :

SPAD - Spool Administration
SCC4 - Client Administration - Logical System
RZ10- Instance profiles
SP01 - Spool delete old spool requests

PART3: INSTALL SAP NW JAVA / ADS

STEP 1: PREPARE SYSTEM Prepare Linux Server as below for the appliance. The values in Used column below show the minimum size needed. Total filesystem needed is min 70GB for installation.

Plan the change of SID, hostname, instance number. Please refer to the notes below for reserved SIDs SAP Note 1979280 â€“ Reserved SAP System Identifiers (SAPSID) with Software Provisioning Manager and hostnames SAP Note 611361 â€“ Hostnames of SAP ABAP Platform servers

The table below shows standard SID and hostnames and what we are changing it to.

The /etc/hostname and /etc/host file is below:

STEP 2: EXTRACT FILES

Extract files 51059242_5.ZIP  in /sapmedia

sid-j2d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_5.ZIP

We will install Java instance from files in  /sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPNetWeaver750SP32ASJAVAwithAdobeDocumentServices

cd /sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPNetWeaver750SP32ASJAVAwithAdobeDocumentServices

In the next step we will extract the above *.tgz files but please note the directories size is as follows so you can provide ample space:

These files will be extracted under /sapmnt/J2E; /usr/sap/J2E and /sybase/J2E. After these are extracted you can rename the filesystem or remount with changed mount points.

sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat dblog.tgz-*  | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat dbexe.tgz-*  | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat dbdata.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat sapmnt_j2e.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat usrsap_j2e.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /

STEP 3: GET PASSWORDS Download the file below and open the file in Internet Explorer to note passwords:
/sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPNetWeaver750SP32ASJAVAwithAdobeDocumentServices/SAP_Software_Appliance.xml

STEP 4: RENAME MOUNT POINTS You can take a full OS backup at this point and rename mount points or directories to /sybase/J2D; /sapmnt/J2D; /usr/sap/J2D. The old standard mount points do not have to exist. After reboot ensure all new renamed mount points are valid.

STEP 5 EXTRACT SWPM Extract SWPM in folder /install. Use the SAPCAR already available to extract.

sid-j2d:/install #/sapmnt/J2D/exe/uc/linuxx86_64/SAPCAR -xvf /sapmedia/SWPM10SP45_2-20009701.SAR

STEP 6 RENAME SAP SYSTEM Rename instance using sapinst

sid-j2d:/install # ./sapinst SAPINST_USE_HOSTNAME=vhcalj2dci 

Copy below URL into chrome browser to start sapinst rename process:

https://sid-j2d.dummy.nodomain:4237/sapinst/docs/index.html

In SAPINST select System Rename => Standard System => SAP System Rename

At the screen Software Integrity click on Next

At screen SAP System Parameters enter Source System J2E and Target System J2D:
Click on Next.

At the screen Prerequisite Checker Results accept or fix the Prerequisite check results.
Click on Next. No if you don't want to repeat the test

At the screen SAP Instance Parameters accept or change the Target System Instance Numbers.
Click on Next.

At the screen Database System Type keep the default selection SAP Adaptive Server Enterprise for Business Suite

At the screen Operating System Users accept master password or enter password Xxxxxxxn

At the screen Operating System User for SAP Database Administrator enter the password for sybj2d and User ID and Click on Next

At the screen SAP ASE Database System Parameters accept or change ports and Click on Next

At the screen Database User Passwords enter the passwords for user sa, sapsa, sapsso, SAPSR3DB which is Welcome_2Welcome_2. Click on Next

At the screen DNS Domain Name checkmark Set FQDN for SAP System and enter domain name dummy.nodomain Click on Next

At the screen Media Browser select the media Package Location and Click on Next

At next screen Cleanup of Operating System Users checkmark on Yes cleanup os users and click on Next

Here is the Parameter Summary Click on Next to confirm and begin the installation.

After about 10mins, the installation process will stop at this point.

You may get Warning below for rename of profile parameter. Found possible references to the source system in the profile directory of the target system /sapmnt/J2D/profile 

Please take note and proceed.

After the sapinst installation is complete, you can manually start/stop the SAP Java instance J2D using old startsap / stopsap commands

sid-j2d:/install # su - j2dadm
sid-j2d:j2dadm > startsap

To access JAVA server as SAP Netweaver Administrator the URL is:
https://sid-j2d.dummy.nodomain:50000/nwa

Standard users are as follows:
JAVA Administrator â€“ Adminitstrator / <Master Password> ;
Java user BPINST/Welcome1

STEP 7: POST STEPS Follow steps from guide attached to SAP Note 2041140 - First Steps for on-premise installations.pdf - Section 5 Technical Post-deployment Activities

Apply product license keys if you haven't installed during swpm install step before. Technical restrictions may apply if you donâ€™t install the license. Use the link to obtain license key. SAPNetweaver 7.5 J2EE license key has to be installed via SAP Netweaver Administrator

Further post-installation checks
Adapt any SAP parameters due to changed SID
After instance is started and confirmed you can delete the sapmedia folder.

SUPPORT TICKETS:

If you have any difficulty downloading the media open OSS message using component XX-SER-SAPSMP-SWC. If you have issues with technical deployment open message with component BC-INS-SRN.

OTHER REFERENCES:

SAP S/4HANA Fully-Activated Appliance: Create your SAP S/4HANA system in a fraction of the usual setup time
SAP S/4HANA Fully-Activated Appliance: Demo Guides

Blogs with known issues (2022 / 2021 / 2020), continuously updated

2041140 - Order an SAP pre-assembled Best Practices software appliance (as partner or customer)

Thank you. Hope you enjoyed the installation.

Mahesh Sardesai
Product Expert â€“ S/4HANA

entry.title: S/4HANA 2025 FPS0 Fully-Activated Appliance custom installation
entry.content:
This blog covers installation of (1) SAP S/4HANA server and (2) SAP NW JAVA / ADS server as shown in the graphic below. The installation is based on file restore and is different from the standard installs using SWPM.

Please refer to S/4HANA SQUARE ONE for other blogs

In this blog the procedure is simplified for hostname change and SID change. Also if you want to change instance number the command, screens show where you can change the instance number. This would make sense if your network cannot accommodate the unique hostname and SID. Also if it is a more permanent installation you may like to change SID and hostname.

If you want to do standard installation with no change in hostname and sid please refer to other blog In this blog the procedure is simplified for standard installation with NO HOSTNAME OR SID CHANGE. The advantage with this is that you don't have to do many of the steps related to SID change and it does make sense if you will be installing the instance temporarily.

This blog is based on a fresh installation of SUSE Linux for SAP OS without having any previous SAP instances created and deleted. I did not have to pre install hostagent, etc. There are mount points/links to be setup as shown in the right place in the directory structure. The steps in the guides provided with SAP Note 2041140 could be used as a reference in case there are issues specific to your environment. Just follow the steps below to install both systems shown in red square below:

Please find below the main note for ordering the appliance:
2041140 - Order an SAP pre-assembled Best Practices software appliance (as partner or customer)

PART1: SOFTWARE DOWNLOAD

Please download the software media from https://me.sap.com/softwarecenter
INSTALLATIONS & UPGRADES => By Alphabetical Index (A-Z) => S => SAP S/4HANA => SAP S/4HANA 2025 => S/4HANA FULLY-ACTIVATED APPLIANCE => SAP S/4HANA 2025 FA APPL

On SAP S/4HANA Server, download the 51059242_1 to 51059242_5  files and SWPM20SP22_5-80003424.SAR (or later).

On SAP NW JAVA / ADS server, download the 51059242_5, SWPM10SP45_4-20009701.SAR and 51050829_JAVA_part 1 & 2 - NW 7.5 Java based SW Comp.

PART2: INSTALL SAP S/4HANA

STEP 1: PREPARE SYSTEM Prepare Linux Server as below for the appliance. The values in Used column below show the minimum size needed. For /sapmnt provide min 30GB, /hana/data space - min 500GB, /hana/log min 120GB. I have used /sapmedia - 200GB temporary separate mount that can be removed later.

Plan the change of SID, hostname, instance number. Please refer to the notes below for reserved SIDs SAP Note 1979280 - Reserved SAP System Identifiers (SAPSID) with Software Provisioning Manager and hostnames SAP Note 611361 - Hostnames of SAP ABAP Platform servers
The table below shows standard SID and hostnames and what we are changing it to.

The /etc/hostname and /etc/host file is below. If you are changing hostname for db and sap add the standard and new hostname for DB but for SAP only provide new hostname. Also for J2E include the new hostname only as this is on separate instance. The standard hostname can be removed later as shown in the steps below. Please note that it has

STEP 2: EXTRACT FILES Extract files 51059242_*  in /sapmedia

sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_1.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_2.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_3.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_4.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_5.ZIP

Allow approx 2 hours for extraction.

We will install Central system with DB and App on same server. Please move all *.tgz-* files (from 51059242_1 to 51059242_4) to /sapmedia/51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1

cd /sapmedia/51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1
mv /sapmedia/51059242_2/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_2/*.tgz-*   .
mv /sapmedia/51059242_3/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_3/*.tgz-*   .
mv /sapmedia/51059242_4/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_4/*.tgz-*   .
mv /sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_5/*.tgz-*   .

In the next step we will extract the above *.tgz files but please note the directories size is as follows so you can provide ample space:

Please use command below to extract the database related archives:

sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia/# cd 51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1

cat dblog.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner -zpxvf - -C /

Similarly extract the remaining files:

cat dbexe.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner -zpxvf - -C /
cat dbdata.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner -zpxvf - -C /

It takes about an hour for extraction.

Below two Application related archives may be extracted on a separate app server for distributed installation. These files will be extracted under /sapmnt/S4H and /usr/sap/S4H so if you are changing the SID, then you will have to first extract to SID-S4H and then create links to your own SID like S4D

Then extract the files:
sid-hdd-s4d:/usr/sap #cd 51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1
cat usrsap_s4h.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner  -zpxvf - -C /
cat sapmnt_s4h.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner  -zpxvf - -C /

STEP 3: GET PASSWORDS Download the file below and open the file in Internet Explorer to note passwords:
/sapmedia/51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_5/SAP_Software_Appliance.xml


Follow this procedure as it is a known issue, please refer SAP Note 2082466 - Known Issues in SAP HANA Platform Lifecycle Management (HDBLCM)  (Issue# 69)

cd /hana/shared/HDB/HDB02/vhcalhdbdb
rm .daemon.ini.swp

vi daemon.ini
Edit section [localsecurestore] to change instances = 0

STEP 4: REGISTER DATABASE 

The HANA DB hdblcm register_rename_system command will rename the filesystem for you according to the new target SID for Hana database instance. HDB => HDD.

Please ensure groupid=1000 is free and groupid=79 are free. Use SAP Note 3686516 for troubleshooting.

Execute HANA database specific steps as below:

sid-hdd-s4d: ##/hana/shared/HDB/hdblcm/hdblcm --action=register_rename_system  --groupid=1000 --lss_groupid=79

TIP: Places where you need to enter data is indicated, rest all are default options. Please note hdblcm now includes rename database host and a separate step with command to rename db host (hdblcm --action=rename_system --hostmap=vhcalhdbdb=vhcalhdddb) is not required. Also a separate step to rename mount points (hdblcm --action=register_rename_system) is not required.

This should bring up the database processes as below

sid-hdd-s4d: #/usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 02 -function GetProcessList

TIP: At this point it is necessary to install the HANA database license as the database will be started in restricted mode.

STEP 5: EXTRACT SWPM Extract SWPM in folder /install. Use the SAPCAR already available to extract.

sid-hdd-s4d:/install #/sapmnt/S4D/exe/uc/linuxx86_64/SAPCAR -xvf /sapmedia/SWPM20SP22_5-80003424.SAR

STEP 6: RENAME SAP SYSTEM Rename instance using sapinst

sid-hdd-s4d:/install # ./sapinst SAPINST_ENFORCE_CRL=false SAPINST_USE_HOSTNAME=vhcals4dci SAPINST_GUI_HOSTNAME=vhcals4dci 

Copy below URL into chrome browser to start sapinst rename process:

https://sid-hdd-s4d.dummy.nodomain:4237/sapinst/docs/index.html

In SAPINST select System Rename => Standard System => SAP System Rename

At screen SAP System Parameters enter Source System S4H and Target System S4D:
Click on Next.

At the screen Prerequisite Checker Results accept or fix the Prerequisite check results.
Click on Next. No if you don't want to repeat the test

At the screen SAP Instance Parameters accept or change the Target System Instance Numbers.
Click on Next.

At the screen SAP HANA Database Connectivity enter Instance Number 02(or changed number) and Password Appliance__1234. Click on Next.

If you don't install HANA DB license you will get error below. Install license using HANA Studio and continue. License is required if there is a database SID change..

At the screen SAP HANA Database Parameter you can change Schema User , DBACOCKPIT and SYSTEM password. Please note it is also optional to change the schema user SAPHANADB password along with DBACOCKPIT and SYSTEM users.

At the screen Database Schema accept schema SAPHANADB password and confirm Schema password Xxxxxxxn click on Next.

At the screen Rename Tenant Database click on Next

At the screen Secure Storage for Database Connection select HANA Secure User tore (hdbuserstore) click on Next 

At the screen Operating System Users accept master password or enter password Xxxxxxxn
At the screen Secure Storage Key Generation accept radio button â€“ Individual Key (Recommended for Productive Systems) On the Next
At next screen Warning click OK
At the screen DNS Domain Name checkmark Set FQDN for SAP System and enter domain name dummy.nodomain Click on Next
At the screen Install License Key keep unchecked Install License Key. Click on Next
TIP: It is much easier to install the license by providing the file than doing it later through the application.
At next screen Cleanup of Encryption Key checkmark on Yes cleanup os users and click on Next
At next screen Cleanup of Operating System Users checkmark on Yes cleanup os users and click on Next
Here is the Parameter Summary Click on Next to confirm and begin the installation.

TIP: In case you get this ERROR:

(1) Error occurs when executing command 'changekey' using the command line tool 'rsecssfx'.

RESOLUTION: Follow SAP Note 2800204 - SSFX-0362: Value file "-" does not start with the UTF-8 byte order mark

Ensure the environment variable LC_CTYPE of the user running sapinst is set as LC_CTYPE=en_US.
Stop the current sapinst and restart it. Continue with the existing option.

(2) You may get Warning below for rename of profile parameter. Found possible references to the source system in the profile directory of the target system /sapmnt/S4D/profile 

After sapinst process is finished you can manually start the SAP instance S4D

sid-hdd-s4d:/install # /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 01 -function StartSystem ALL
sid-hdd-s4d:/install # /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 00 -function StartSystem ALL

After instance is started and confirmed you can delete the sapmedia folder and remove temporary links to S4H as well as temporary hostnames.

Standard users are as follows:
HANA DB â€“ Instance 02 SYSTEM /<Master Password> or as you changed in above
Web Dispatcher access : bpinst/Welcome1

STEP 7: POST STEPS Follow steps from guide attached to SAP Note 2041140 - First Steps for on-premise installations.pdf => Section 5 Technical Post-deployment Activities

Adapt HANA connections in DBACOCKPIT (nothing was required to be done here).

Host name / port in table HTTPURLLOC using tcode httpurlloc

Adapt RFC Connections

ABAP connections:
â€¢ LOCAL_RFC
â€¢ S4DCLNT100, S4DCLNT200, S4DCLNT400
â€¢ S4D_RFC

HTTP connections:
â€¢ ADS (pointing to the JAVA server after PART3: INSTALL SAP NW JAVA /ADS)
â€¢ LOCAL_HTTP
â€¢ LOCAL_HTTPS
â€¢ S4FIN_HTTPS

SAP Enable Now Web Assistant enter tCode /UI2/FLP_CUS_CONF

Adapt the Fiori notification URL. enter tCode /UI2/FLP_SYS_CONF

Adapt Enterprise Search

Apply product license keys

Install software product license key: Technical restrictions may apply if you donâ€™t install the license. Use the link to obtain license key.
HANA DB license key can be installed via HANA Studio (Preferences -> License)
In SAP S/4HANA 1909 the license key is installed via SAP logon tCode SLICENSE

Further post-installation checks

Install SAP client tools on your local computers

You can take a full backup and remove the temporary links that were setup for S4H

In client 000 fix transport configuration. Enter tCode SE06 and reinstall CTS transport system, Change originals to S4D, Delete old TMS config, delete old versions of transport routes

Adapt any SAP parameters due to changed SID

The database should be with log mode overwrite and you may like to change that as needed.Please carry out the the other basis steps that are usually done with SID change/System refresh :

SPAD - Spool Administration
SCC4 - Client Administration - Logical System
RZ10- Instance profiles
SP01 - Spool delete old spool requests

PART3: INSTALL SAP NW JAVA / ADS

STEP 1: PREPARE SYSTEM Prepare Linux Server as below for the appliance. The values in Used column below show the minimum size needed. Total filesystem needed is min 70GB for installation.

Plan the change of SID, hostname, instance number. Please refer to the notes below for reserved SIDs SAP Note 1979280 â€“ Reserved SAP System Identifiers (SAPSID) with Software Provisioning Manager and hostnames SAP Note 611361 â€“ Hostnames of SAP ABAP Platform servers

The table below shows standard SID and hostnames and what we are changing it to.

The /etc/hostname and /etc/host file is below:

STEP 2: EXTRACT FILES

Extract files 51059242_5.ZIP  in /sapmedia

sid-j2d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_5.ZIP

We will install Java instance from files in  /sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPNetWeaver750SP32ASJAVAwithAdobeDocumentServices

cd /sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPNetWeaver750SP32ASJAVAwithAdobeDocumentServices

In the next step we will extract the above *.tgz files but please note the directories size is as follows so you can provide ample space:

These files will be extracted under /sapmnt/J2E; /usr/sap/J2E and /sybase/J2E. After these are extracted you can rename the filesystem or remount with changed mount points.

sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat dblog.tgz-*  | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat dbexe.tgz-*  | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat dbdata.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat sapmnt_j2e.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat usrsap_j2e.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /

STEP 3: GET PASSWORDS Download the file below and open the file in Internet Explorer to note passwords:
/sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPNetWeaver750SP32ASJAVAwithAdobeDocumentServices/SAP_Software_Appliance.xml

STEP 4: RENAME MOUNT POINTS You can take a full OS backup at this point and rename mount points or directories to /sybase/J2D; /sapmnt/J2D; /usr/sap/J2D. The old standard mount points do not have to exist. After reboot ensure all new renamed mount points are valid.

STEP 5 EXTRACT SWPM Extract SWPM in folder /install. Use the SAPCAR already available to extract.

sid-j2d:/install #/sapmnt/J2D/exe/uc/linuxx86_64/SAPCAR -xvf /sapmedia/SWPM10SP45_2-20009701.SAR

STEP 6 RENAME SAP SYSTEM Rename instance using sapinst

sid-j2d:/install # ./sapinst SAPINST_USE_HOSTNAME=vhcalj2dci 

Copy below URL into chrome browser to start sapinst rename process:

https://sid-j2d.dummy.nodomain:4237/sapinst/docs/index.html

In SAPINST select System Rename => Standard System => SAP System Rename

At the screen Software Integrity click on Next

At screen SAP System Parameters enter Source System J2E and Target System J2D:
Click on Next.

At the screen Prerequisite Checker Results accept or fix the Prerequisite check results.
Click on Next. No if you don't want to repeat the test

At the screen SAP Instance Parameters accept or change the Target System Instance Numbers.
Click on Next.

At the screen Database System Type keep the default selection SAP Adaptive Server Enterprise for Business Suite

At the screen Operating System Users accept master password or enter password Xxxxxxxn

At the screen Operating System User for SAP Database Administrator enter the password for sybj2d and User ID and Click on Next

At the screen SAP ASE Database System Parameters accept or change ports and Click on Next

At the screen Database User Passwords enter the passwords for user sa, sapsa, sapsso, SAPSR3DB which is Welcome_2Welcome_2. Click on Next

At the screen DNS Domain Name checkmark Set FQDN for SAP System and enter domain name dummy.nodomain Click on Next

At the screen Media Browser select the media Package Location and Click on Next

At next screen Cleanup of Operating System Users checkmark on Yes cleanup os users and click on Next

Here is the Parameter Summary Click on Next to confirm and begin the installation.

After about 10mins, the installation process will stop at this point.

You may get Warning below for rename of profile parameter. Found possible references to the source system in the profile directory of the target system /sapmnt/J2D/profile 

Please take note and proceed.

After the sapinst installation is complete, you can manually start/stop the SAP Java instance J2D using old startsap / stopsap commands

sid-j2d:/install # su - j2dadm
sid-j2d:j2dadm > startsap

To access JAVA server as SAP Netweaver Administrator the URL is:
https://sid-j2d.dummy.nodomain:50000/nwa

Standard users are as follows:
JAVA Administrator â€“ Adminitstrator / <Master Password> ;
Java user BPINST/Welcome1

STEP 7: POST STEPS Follow steps from guide attached to SAP Note 2041140 - First Steps for on-premise installations.pdf - Section 5 Technical Post-deployment Activities

Apply product license keys if you haven't installed during swpm install step before. Technical restrictions may apply if you donâ€™t install the license. Use the link to obtain license key. SAPNetweaver 7.5 J2EE license key has to be installed via SAP Netweaver Administrator

Further post-installation checks
Adapt any SAP parameters due to changed SID
After instance is started and confirmed you can delete the sapmedia folder.

SUPPORT TICKETS:

If you have any difficulty downloading the media open OSS message using component XX-SER-SAPSMP-SWC. If you have issues with technical deployment open message with component BC-INS-SRN.

OTHER REFERENCES:

SAP S/4HANA Fully-Activated Appliance: Create your SAP S/4HANA system in a fraction of the usual setup time
SAP S/4HANA Fully-Activated Appliance: Demo Guides

Blogs with known issues (2022 / 2021 / 2020), continuously updated

2041140 - Order an SAP pre-assembled Best Practices software appliance (as partner or customer)

Thank you. Hope you enjoyed the installation.

Mahesh Sardesai
Product Expert â€“ S/4HANA

entry.title: La stratÃ©gie SAP Business Network pour lâ€™avenir de la facturation Ã©lectronique
entry.content:
De nombreux gouvernements dans le monde rÃ©alisent peu Ã  peu les avantages quâ€™offre la numÃ©risation, notamment la rapiditÃ©, la transparence et, particuliÃ¨rement en matiÃ¨re de facturation, l'amÃ©lioration du contrÃ´le fiscal. Les entreprises du monde entier voient donc un nombre croissant de pays introduire des portails de facturation Ã©lectronique ou fiscaux, associÃ©s Ã  des obligations de conformitÃ©. Les processus de facturation traversent un changement fondamental Ã  lâ€™Ã©chelle mondiale qui ne peut Ãªtre ignorÃ©, et la conformitÃ© devient le principal argument des organisations lorsqu'elles choisissent un prestataire de transformation digitale.

 

Que signifie une obligation dâ€™e-facturation?

Chaque pays avance Ã  sa propre vitesse, au fur et Ã  mesure de leur progrÃ¨s dans la digitalisation de leurs services et de lâ€™autoritÃ© fiscale. La facturation par l'intermÃ©diaire d'un portail gouvernemental est par exemple une rÃ©alitÃ© depuis prÃ¨s de deux dÃ©cennies au BrÃ©sil, et l'Europe connaÃ®t le mÃªme changement depuis quelques annÃ©es, avec l'introduction de SDI en Italie, de NAV en Hongrie, ou de PEPPOL pour le secteur public dans l'ensemble de l'UE. Ces portails devenant ainsi progressivement une partie obligatoire du processus de facturation. Une obligation dâ€™e-facturation peut donc signifier de nombreuses choses diffÃ©rentes: une norme de format, un reporting obligatoire des factures sur un portail gouvernemental, voire un processus entiÃ¨rement intÃ©grÃ© d'approbation des factures et d'interopÃ©rabilitÃ© entre systÃ¨mes.
En rÃ©sumÃ©, la facturation est devenue plus complexe, en particulier pour les sociÃ©tÃ©s opÃ©rant dans plusieurs rÃ©gions, pays ou juridictions. Notre collÃ¨gue Christoph Neumann aborde certains de ces scÃ©narios dans un rÃ©cent webinaire, prÃ©sentÃ© en anglais.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Une complexitÃ© supplÃ©mentaire pour les entreprises

Afin de rÃ©pondre aux exigences de conformitÃ© rÃ©glementaire, les entreprises doivent rester au fait des rÃ©glementations en constante Ã©volution et s'intÃ©grer aux portails ou rÃ©seaux des administrations locales, ce qui rend souvent leur solution actuelle de facturation Ã©lectronique redondante. Pour un fournisseur, il peut devenir fastidieux de recevoir des bons de commande dans un portail choisi, mais de facturer sur le portail imposÃ© par le gouvernement. Cela est inefficace et compromet la valeur de rÃ©seaux professionnels tels que SAP Business Network.

 

Notre stratÃ©gie pour l'avenir

Sur base d'un dialogue constant avec nos clients, nous avons Ã©tabli une vision et une stratÃ©gie, que nous avons prÃ©sentÃ©es dans un article prÃ©cÃ©dent et qui se rÃ©sume comme suit :

Au-delÃ  de la conformitÃ© rÃ©glementaire, SAP Business Network vise Ã  rationaliser la collaboration interentreprises, en transformant la maniÃ¨re dont les sociÃ©tÃ©s travaillent avec leurs partenaires commerciaux et les autoritÃ©s fiscales du monde entier, Ã  l'aide d'applications SAP et partenaires.

Pour concrÃ©tiser cette vision, quatre innovations majeures sont prÃ©vues pour faÃ§onner le dÃ©veloppement futur de SAP Business Network :
Tout d'abord, nous allons devenir un rÃ©seau ouvert en offrant aux fournisseurs un point d'accÃ¨s unique pour la facturation sortante afin d'envoyer des factures conformes Ã  la loi Ã  lâ€™ensemble de leurs clients, quâ€™ils soient ou non sur SAP Business Network.
DeuxiÃ¨mement, nous voulons amÃ©liorer la gestion des litiges liÃ©s aux factures grÃ¢ce Ã  des workflows intÃ©grÃ©s et optimisÃ©s par l'IA pour rÃ©duire les efforts manuels et offrir une rÃ©solution plus rapide, dans l'intÃ©rÃªt des acheteurs et des fournisseurs.
Ensuite, nous amÃ©liorerons la visibilitÃ© du statut des factures grÃ¢ce au perfectionnement des codes dâ€™erreur et motifs de rejet. Il s'agit lÃ  d'un problÃ¨me rÃ©current pour les fournisseurs.
Enfin, nous prÃ©voyons de rÃ©tablir les validations des exigences client pour les acheteurs (Â« Business rules Â»), ce qui permet lâ€™envoi de factures conformes aux attentes du client.

Ã€ l'avenir, les fournisseurs pourront donc utiliser SAP Business Network en tant que prestataire unique pour atteindre tous leurs clients, avec l'assurance que toutes les complexitÃ©s nationales et les exigences de facturation sont prises en charge. La rÃ©duction des litiges liÃ©s aux factures et l'amÃ©lioration de la visibilitÃ© sur les erreurs ou les motifs de rejet offriront une expÃ©rience de facturation Ã©lectronique fluide et un canal de communication unique pour les fournisseurs et leurs clients.

 

La conformitÃ© croissante de SAP Business Network

Chez SAP, la conformitÃ© n'est que le dÃ©but. Nous avons toujours suivi les Ã©volutions des mandats fiscaux et de facturation et fait le nÃ©cessaire pour rester conformes. Ainsi, le rÃ©seau est dÃ©jÃ  conforme dans les pays qui exigent actuellement l'utilisation d'un portail gouvernemental ou oÃ¹ certaines particularitÃ©s s'appliquent.

Plus important encore, SAP Business Network offre une valeur ajoutÃ©e au-delÃ  de la simple conformitÃ© rÃ©glementaire : les fournisseurs peuvent compter sur ses nombreuses fonctionnalitÃ©s intuitives et robustes pour automatiser, optimiser et dÃ©velopper leur activitÃ© commerciale. Pour n'en nommer que quelques-unes :

  • une offre flexible adaptÃ©e Ã  vos besoins avec deux types de compte et un abonnement, 
  • une interface intuitive et un principe de facturation PO-flip efficace, 
  • la visibilitÃ© sur le statut des factures et une messagerie instantanÃ©e pour une communication fluide avec les clients, 
  • la crÃ©ation dâ€™un profil commercial complet avec des informations sur la conformitÃ© et la durabilitÃ©, 
  • des catalogues Ã©lectroniques publics et privÃ©s pour promouvoir les produits et services, 
  • des outils de reporting et dâ€™analyse de performance uniques, mis en contexte avec le reste de lâ€™industrie, afin de fournir les donnÃ©es nÃ©cessaires aux conversations stratÃ©giques, 
  • des opportunitÃ©s de croissance via la dÃ©couverte de nouveaux acheteurs.

La combinaison unique de ces fonctionnalitÃ©s et de l'engagement envers notre stratÃ©gie fait de SAP Business Network la solution de choix pour toutes les entreprises Ã  la recherche d'une valeur stratÃ©gique au-delÃ  des simples transactions.

Pour plus d'informations, vous trouverez ici notre stratÃ©gie dÃ©taillÃ©e sur la facturation Ã©lectronique (en anglais).

 

Continuez Ã  vous informer en vous abonnant au terme SAP Business Network for Suppliers, en cliquant simplement sur le bouton bleu en haut de cette page.

Vous recherchez plus de contenu pour les fournisseurs SAP Business Network? Visitez notre page dÃ©diÃ©e!

entry.title: SAP CRM â€“ Column selection is not retained (New to CRM)
entry.content:
I am new to SAP CRM and I am facing an issue with a column selection.

In SAP CRM, when I select a value in a specific column and then navigate away from the screen or refresh it, the selection is cleared and not retained.
The expected behavior is that the selected value should remain in the column.

Since I am new to SAP CRM, I am not sure whether this is standard system behavior or if there is a configuration, user parameter, or enhancement that controls this.

Any guidance or suggestions would be appreciated.

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: My experience with Joule for Consultants PoC
entry.content:
Joule for Consultants; sentiments after a few weeks.

Key words: SAP; Joule; Joule for Consultants;

Introduction:

I was one of the lucky ones to join the Joule for Consultants (J4C) Proof of Concept. I have been using this product for quite a few months, and I would like to share my findings. Most of all I am quite positive.

Having a technical and development background I was very curious about where J4C could support me, knowing that thereâ€™s a Joule for Developers as well (and even free to use).

On a side note: this article is fully written by a human, even though it writes about the use of AI. The only em-dash youâ€™ll find is in this sentence, and itâ€™s right here: â€œâ€”â€.

What is Joule for Consultants (J4C).

According to SAP marketing, it is a silver bullet: â€œSAP Joule for Consultants accelerates SAP projects and cloud transformations with the most authoritative AI assistance grounded in exclusive SAP knowledge. It enables consultants to increase productivity with fast and reliable answers, minimize rework with expert-level guidance that improves every design decision, and deliver more operational efficiency by ensuring projects align with best practices.â€ There is a more descriptive landing page with a more concise description: â€œSAP Joule for Consultants is a conversational AI solution that accelerates SAP cloud transformations with expert guidance from SAPâ€™s most exclusive and up-to-date knowledge base.â€. You can even find a course on the learning hub.

Or, in my own words, Joule for Consultants is a chat based AI solution that lets you quickly search in SAP documentation, coding, OSS notes and knowledge base.

How did I use J4C?

If you start J4C, you get a prompt, stating â€œMessage Jouleâ€¦â€. Straightforward and effective, in the style of other popular LLM AIâ€™s.

There are a few shortcuts to help you in your way:

For example, the â€œQuick Linksâ€, give examples of effective and less effective prompts. I like to read these quite often, as it helps in giving a more useful result.

And after this, the real journey starts. Letâ€™s give a real-life example.

I was asked to maintain and change a few forms in SD, so I started with the question: â€œWhat are the best practices in SAP S/4HANA, private edition, for configuring forms for different types of sales documents?â€. I found the result quite impressive. It shows an overview of sales documents, followed by best practices, technical configuration, document specific configuration, integration considerations, testing, common pitfalls and maintenance. It took input from the SAP Learning hub, the SAP OSS Notes, the online documentation and the SAP Community pages, combining it in one useful, comprehensive format.

This was a good introduction, but I was searching for a specific form. In hindsight, my question was not specific enough, so I asked for details: â€œGive me an example on how in customizing I can couple a document type to a specific formâ€.  A quite extensive list follows, including the customizing path, different transactions like NACE, VOV8 etc. It also refers to output types, condition tables and access sequences. Again, several related topics like troubleshooting, testing and best practices are included.

With this, I can almost start, but my client has a complex setup. So, I would like to know more about conditions records: â€œExplain how to maintain and test condition records for Output Determination in detail with examples.â€

And voila, I have exactly what I need to start. This saved me several hours of digging or questioning my functional counterpart.

I tried the same questions in LeChat (Mistral), ChatGPT and Claude. Claude and LeChat show reasonable to good answers, although they are obviously missing the link to OSS notes. ChatGPT suggests SAPscript and SmartForms, next to Adobe Forms. Asking for more details about customizing or condition records yields answers, but all three of them have hallucinations when it comes to transactions, paths or Fiori maintenance apps. Especially ChatGPT is going in a different direction: it starts explaining BRF+.

Is Joule for Consultants always so spot on? Alas, no. Once you get in to more specialized functionality, like the dateline functionality in purchasing (sometimes used in the Retail and Fashion Management suite), it looks like J4C is missing relevant sources and documentation. It starts nice, but when asking for advice on enhancing the datelines J4C starts to hallucinate with non-existing or obsolete BAdIâ€™s.

I also noticed that J4C oftentimes mixes input from sources describing Public Cloud solutions with Private Cloud solutions. This leads to confusing answers, but it still saves me a lot of time.

Development

Although it is called Joule for Consultants, as a developer I wanted to see the capabilities of judging (ABAP) source code. I specifically used ABAP, as the competitors mentioned earlier are good with JavaScript solutions. I uploaded a not very well-designed ABAP program (using an ALV) and used the predefined question:

The first result was OK-ish, but I was a bit disappointed after the previous results. So I asked Joule to elaborate: â€œGive me advice on how to improve the design of the programâ€. And oh my, this was good: I got a list of aspects where to improve:

  1. Architecture & Structure Improvements
  2. Error Handling & Robustness
  3. Performance Optimizations
  4. Code Quality Enhancements
  5. Modern ABAP Features
  6. Transaction Management
  7. User Experience Improvements
  8. Security & Authorization
  9. Testing & Maintainability
  10. Suggested Refactored Structure

This was way more than expected, and a lot more detailed. Again, the other LLM-AIâ€™s are not that good with ABAP, but Joule 4C is impressive. Especially, digging deeper with questions like â€œGive me examples of Implementing dependency injectionâ€ and â€œExplain the pros and cons of each suggestionâ€ gives understandable and valuable responses focused on ABAP development.

Conclusion

Overall, I am satisfied with J4C. It saves me a lot of time. The answers are always in context of SAP, and mostly up to date. This is a plus compared to the more open standard LLM AIâ€™s, who mix in a lot of old ECC answers. J4C is not perfect yet, especially in less-used areas of SAPâ€™s functionality, or when it mixes private (and on-premise) vs public cloud answers .

entry.title: Whatâ€™s New in Transportation Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 - FP01
entry.content:
Today the latest Feature Package 01 (FP01) of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 and SAP S/4HANA 2025 OP was released.

With this feature package we deliver once again great innovations that our customers have been waiting for.

Let's start with two features in the context of TM-based scheduling of ERP documents.
As you certainly know, we have introduced scheduling with TM for Sales Orders with Feature Package 01 of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2023.
We received a lot of customer feedback on how to improve the functionality especially regarding the selection of means of transport and vehicle type.
Traditionally, TM-based Sales Order Scheduling relied only on a default means of transport. Many customers needed a rule-based, flexible way to determine the correct transport mode (e.g., parcel express, LTL, FTL, truck types) during scheduling of sales orders. Until now, that wasnâ€™t possible.
That's why we introduce the

Rule-Based Means of Transport (MTR) & Vehicle Type Determination for TM-based sales order scheduling

To make TM-based sales order scheduling more flexible we have introduced a  new TM condition type (MTRVT_DET) that enables rule-based determination of Means of Transport and the Vehicle Type during scheduling in TM.
The solution uses the well proven and flexible BRF+ condition technique. 
The rules can evaluate multiple factors such as weight, volume, locations, service levels, transportation groups, material freight groups, and even date validity. They can be maintained across regions or business units, tested via simulation, and exported or imported through Excel.

RACR-Screen shows that Means of transport is considered during TRS

Another improvement of this innovation is, that TRS can calculate more accurate lead times as also the appropriate factory calendars, shift sequences, loading and unloading durations, and driving and working constraints are taken into account.
Existing routing methods - including lane-based routing, straight-line distances, default routes, and network path determination - have all been enhanced to respect the selected MTR when it is available.

To support configuration and testing, SAP has also expanded the TRS and Network Path Determination test cockpits with new input parameters and clearer visibility into determination results. Additionally, new BAdIs and append structures allow customers to introduce custom fields or override standard logic while still adhering to clean-core principles.

The big advantage of this great innovation is, that scheduling for sales orders with TRS can now much better reflect real world conditions and therefor provide a much more accurate result to sales representatives. 

Planning and Network
functionality has also been greatly improved and many cool innovations such as

Capacity Document Creation with Load Consolidation

With this enhancement is now possible to combine requirements grouping with load consolidation. The users can dynamically choose between multiple equipment types and use either capacity-based or load-planning-based consolidation.
This new feature improves planning accuracy and reduces manual work and is valid for single-source, single-destination scenarios.

 Creation of capacity document & load consolidation based on freight group

There are also enhancements done in Freight Unit Building:
First of all Packaging information created in Sales Orders and Deliveries is now carried over into Freight Units. As a consequence if packaging already exists, TM will not re-run UPB. Also the system stores the UPB engine and rules used in earlier documents. And with that in place improves integration consistency and transparency.

There are additional enhancements in the Package Building Optimizer (PBO).

We have introduced a Cost-Based Selection of Packaging Materials and with this the package building optimizer can now select the optimal set of cartons/pallets based on fixed costs. This extension supports multi-level packaging (cartons â†’ pallets) and enables mixing of pre-defined packaging and optimized packaging. It also considers dimensional checks, incompatibilities, and capacity.

Cost-based selection chooses different packaging materials on both packaging levels

The Package Building Optimization now can use an Automatic Runtime Regulation. This means four runtime modes are introduces, so that either the Fastest, Fast, Balanced (recommended) or Quality mode can be chosen. With this  configuration  is simplified and helps balance solution quality vs. speed.

In the area of Load Planning & Load Consolidation also quite some improvements are delivered with this feature package.

The free positioning load planning now also supports mixed pallet footprints, Cylindrical objects and heterogeneous sizes.
This enhancements lead to better container/truck utilization and therefore can help to reduce the number of containers or trucks needed. 
Furthermore a new rectangular selection feature enables quick multi-object selection and drag-and-drop stacking.

Similar like with the PBO it's now also possible to use an automated runtime regulation.

In the area of master data for the transportation network the schedules are enhanced in a way, that now warehouse doors and stops for loading or unloading can be added in the schedules. These stops are taken over to freight orders that are created manually, VSR or generation reports.
By that manually adding of warehouse stops is not needed anymore.

Also it is now possible to add the vehicle type and equipment type to the schedule, which is also carried over to the freight orders.

 Schedules with extended with vehicle type

Sales Scheduling Agreements

There is also an innovation in the area of scheduling agreements delivered, which has positive influence on performance and system load. Sales Scheduling Agreements accumulate many schedule lines because deliveries occur several times per week or even daily. Since schedule lines in SSAs are deleted once fully delivered, TM had to evaluate all remaining lines with every integration. 
The new enhancement introduces a rule-based, dynamic reduction of the schedule lines considered during TM integration. The concept was adapted from the already existing approach used for Purchase Scheduling Agreements.

The reduction of evaluated schedule line is done by defining rules that determine how many schedule lines are counted within a certain time frame. Depending on this count, the system calculates an integration horizon. That means that the higher the schedule-line density is, the shorter the integration horizon â€” meaning fewer lines must be processed.

 

Enhancements in Logistics Integration

Feature Package 01 for SAP Transportation Management brings a series of meaningful advancements that strengthen the integration between logistics execution and transportation processes.

The main topics are

  • Ad-hoc loading
  • Discrepancies in the context of Adv. SR and Stock Transport Orders (STO)
  • Adv. SR & warehouse-driven ODO-split
  • Taking over package information from LE outbound
  • Central Update of the Logistics Integration Engine for TM-LE
  • Clean core enhancements

Lets have a look into the topics individually:

1.  Ad-hoc loading

A major highlight is the new ad hoc loading capability, which allows warehouse workers to load goods onto a truck even before freight units are assigned to a freight order. Instead of relying on pre-planned transportation structures, the system now identifies the correct freight order dynamically once a handling unit is scanned, dramatically increasing flexibility for warehouse-driven processes. 

This enhancement in Advanced Shipping & Receiving (Adv. SR) is available for both embedded and decentralized ASR setups. Traditionally, outbound processing required all items in an EWM outbound delivery order to be fully picked or packed before marking the document Ready for Shipping, updating the freight order, and enabling loading. An alternative, Immediate Loading, allows loading to begin as soon as at least one handling unit (HU) is prepared, enabling a streaming flow of goods to the truck.

Ad-hoc loading with RF scanning for unplanned freight 

Ad Hoc Loading adds a third, more flexible approach. It supports lean, warehouse-driven outbound processes without upfront transportation planning. Freight orders may start nearly emptyâ€”defined only with a destinationâ€”and loading is executed directly via RF. When an HU is scanned, the system checks whether it matches the freight order (e.g., based on ship-to-party). If matched, the HU and corresponding outbound order are dynamically assigned to the freight order during loading. This allows routine, schedule-based transports (e.g., â€œtruck arrives every Wednesday at door 15â€) and enables incremental loading of all HUs associated with the scanned document. The feature works primarily through RF transactions (loading by door, by HU, or by bill of lading), offering real-time assignment and visibility of remaining items to load.

2.  Discrepancies for Stock Transport Orders (STO) in the context of Adv. SR
The two step process for STOs in the context of Adv. SR was already introduced with FP0, which means in the process the FU will be re-assigned from the outbound to the inbound document for receiving the goods on the inbound warehouse after the GI was posted on the outbound warehouse.
In the process many discrepancies may occur and they could not be handled so far. Now the process can be reversed by reversing process steps dependent on the execution. For instance if the truck is not departed yet then the inbound delivery can be deleted manually (e.g. in the POWL for FUs) and the FU is reassigned to the outbound freight order again.

 Discrepancies during the Adv. S&R process for STOs

So dependent on the status of process chain execution (transport not departed,;Truck on route, but not received; Truck arrived, and ready for warehouse processing in inbound is set) the various process steps can be reversed manually.
This can be done by deletion of inbound delivery, reversal of goods issue, reversal of warehouse ready for unloading.
Most of the processes are done on the outbound process.
If actions are already done in the inbound receiving process (e.g. putaway actions are done), then the reversals are done on the inbound side of the process.

3.  Adv. SR & Warehouse-driven ODO-split
There may be two cases that requires an ODO (Outbound delivery Order) split in EWM. The first case would be that not all HUs can be planned on a single freight order. In this context a new FU as well as new delivery in EWM is created for the not planned HU.
The second case is that after loading not all HUs of a delivery fit physically to a freight order. Also in this case a new FU and a new delivery is created for the not loaded HUs (after loading is reported in the freight order for the loading point).

4.  Handing over packaging information from LE outbound delivery to TM
In a delivery based scenario where FUs are created based on the delivery, if packaging is automatically done based on the packaging instructions in the outbound delivery, the packaging proposal HU is created in the delivery. This information is now transferred to TM including the LE packaging  building engine and rule. 

 Handover of packaging instructions to TM

5.  Logistics Integration Engine for TM-LE for Outbound
A central update is the new Logistics Integration (LI) Engine, which changes how updates are processed once a delivery reaches specific warehouse or transport statuses. Before â€œready for warehouse processingâ€ (transport-driven) or before â€œwarehouse processingâ€ (warehouse-driven), users can still freely change key delivery fields. After these statuses, changes to critical fieldsâ€”such as Incoterms, delivery dates, shipping types, and delivery quantitiesâ€”are restricted to avoid inconsistencies or unintended freight-unit changes. More information can be found in SAP note 3637618

6. Clean Core Enhancements
There are two new Badi's.
The first BAdI is to change TRQ Data (LE and EWM). If customers are using the TTRQ BAdI SCMTMS/BADI_LOGINT_CHG_TTRQ already, they also need to implement this new BAdI /SCMTMS/BADI_LI_UH_MAP as the old BAdI is not called anymore after delivery is released (see impact note SAP note 3637618) 

The second new BAdI /SCMTMS/BADI_LI_ERROR_HNDL is to adoption the error handling and enable customer specific Logistics Integration error categories.


Innovations in Freight Order Management

This feature package introduces a series of powerful enhancements to Freight Order Management, aiming to streamline warehouse operations, simplify Adv. SR (Advanced Shipping & Receiving), and strengthen collaboration with carriers. 

An important innovation is the enablement of Adv. SR without warehouse master data. Previously, customers using simplified shipping scenarios were forced to maintain minimal warehouse configurations just to activate Adv. SR. With the new release, warehouse loading stops can be determined without any warehouse setup, lowering the entry barrier for businesses with lightweight logistics processes and reducing unnecessary configuration effort.

 Adv. SR without warehouse information creates warehouse loading stops

We also enhanced the status part of the Adv. SR process, offering more automation and removing manual steps. Users can now define rule-based item status updates for loading and unloading, allowing the system to automatically mark relevant packages as loaded or unloaded. Additionally, warehouse loading stops can now be automatically set to completion once certain events occurâ€”while still retaining safeguards to avoid unintended follow-up processes. These features together provide a more flexible and efficient execution flow for diverse warehouse environments.

Enhancements to Web Service TransportationOrderConfirmation_In

In the area of external planning, two major enhancements stand out. First, carriers can now perform freight unit splitsâ€”for example, when only part of a shipment fits on a given truck. The system accepts partial planning results, creates the appropriate split freight units and deliveries, and seamlessly updates the freight order. This gives carriers more realistic flexibility, especially in industries with varying cargo sizes, and removes restrictions that previously required perfect one-to-one planning.

Second, external planning now supports driver information exchange, enabling carriers to transmit driver details directly through the transportation order interface. This allows the shipper to store and use this information immediately during check-in and execution without manual updates.

We have enhanced the TransportationOrderConfirmation_In web service, to enabling richer and more flexible driver data updates for freight orders. Previously, the system allowed only two drivers to be assigned and lacked the ability to map drivers to individual transportation stages. The new driver node overcomes these limitations by supporting multi-driver, multi-stage assignments while reducing dependency on manual address entry.

Carriers can now assign any number of drivers and specify exactly which stages they belong to, enabling accurate and scalable handling of complex, multi-stage freight scenarios. When a driver already exists as a business partner in the shipperâ€™s system, carriers can simply provide the internal ID without needing to resend address information; the system automatically retrieves and updates the driverâ€™s profile.

The release also includes supporting content for the ongoing migration from legacy event-handling logic to the new Execution Information Framework. SAP provides detailed documentation, compatibility checks, and a comprehensive cookbook, helping customers move away from deprecated APIs and ensuring their custom logic remains compatible with upcoming changes. Furthermore, the team shared a practical enhancementâ€”developed in collaboration with customer feedbackâ€”that automates warehouse-processing status updates for freight units when carriers are assigned, using the Change Controller Framework. This gives customers a template for extending Adv. SR behavior without modifying standard logic

Automatic attachment creation for paperless shipments

There are not always printouts required for freight orders or other execution documents. And often it is desired to not only print a pdf document, but also automatically store the pdf document as an attachment for instance in the freight order or freight booking.

Now Output (print) documents from PPF in TM can automatically asynchronically be stored as pdf attachment in the execution document. This functionality is customizable and can be turned on in the freight unit, freight order, freight booking, transportation unit, consignment order based on the type customizing.

Enabling Charge Hierarchy in Ocean Tendering

The Ocean Tendering process has been enhanced with a more transparent and flexible pricing model. Previously, shippers and carriers communicated using a simple price limitâ€”a single value exchanged during tendering. While functional, this one-line approach lacked cost breakdowns and made it difficult for shippers to understand what they were paying for or for carriers to negotiate effectively.

To address this, the new release introduces two extended pricing options: Charge Hierarchy and Price Limit to Charge Hierarchy. These offer detailed cost structures that help both parties understand charges such as loading, unloading, port fees, base rates, and other surcharges.

With Charge Hierarchy, shippers send a complete cost breakdown through EDI, and carriers must respond using the same structure. This brings granular transparency and supports cleaner negotiations. The system also uses configuration settings to determine whether charge details are included in the EDI messages.

 Charge hierarchy in ocean booking

The Price Limit to Charge Hierarchy option takes a hybrid approach. Shippers continue to send a simple price limit but signal that they expect the carrier to reply with a full charge breakdown. This provides flexibility for carriers to distribute the total cost into detailed components while keeping the shipperâ€™s initial request simple.

 

Collective Settlement Process with Lean Service Procurement in TM

We introduce the ability to perform collective settlement posting for Lean Service Procurement.
Previously, Lean freight documents could only be posted individually, but the new release finally makes it possible to group multiple freight documents into a single settlement document.

To support this we enhanced two key Fiori apps: Monitor Freight Documents for Accrual and Monitor Freight Settlements for Accrual. Users can now select multiple freight documents and choose whether they should be posted individually, collectively, or according to preset profile rules.

In the process of collective settlement failed collective posting may happen. In such a case the documents are automatically move to the error tab, where users can fix issues and reattempt collective settlement.

Once a collective settlement is created, the system allows users to see all freight documents associated with it directly from the settlement screen. This visibility addresses a long-standing request to make collective groupings fully transparent. The batch report has also been upgraded to support collective postings for Lean Service Procurement documents, while continuing to honor split criteria such as purchasing group, carrier, or Lean/non-Lean mixingâ€”ensuring that incompatible combinations are automatically separated into different settlement documents.

 Collective Settlement from App for Accruals and  Carrier Invoice

There may be two change scenarios in the context of Lean Service Order settlement.
First: When a new charge is added to an already posted freight order, a delta settlement is created without disturbing the existing collective settlement. Second: When an existing charge is changed, the system must cancel the original collective settlement entirely. Once the cancellation occurs, the involved freight orders revert to a state where they can be repostedâ€”some returning to â€œready for confirmation,â€ others to â€œready for posting,â€ depending on what was modified.

New charges can still be added even after a collective settlement has been invoice-verified,- However, existing charge items cannot be modified once verified. 

The Invoice verification process is another highlight.
A new search help field now allows users to retrieve all freight orders linked to a collective settlement simply by entering its settlement number. Users may also invoice individual freight orders from a collective settlement if needed.
Once invoiced, all related freight documents reflect the invoice-verified status, and a single carrier invoice is created if the posting is done collectively.

The freight cost allocation documentâ€”generated after settlementâ€”is now structured so that each line clearly corresponds to an individual freight document. Depending on configuration, mappings can result in either one item per freight document or multiple items when multiple condition types are used.

Charge Calculation at consignment order level

A significant functional expansion is the introduction of cost distribution for consignment orders. Until now, this capability existed only for freight orders. With the new release, consignment orders can calculate freight charges, distribute them across deliveries, and even post them directly into financial accounting. This creates a consistent cost-handling process for businesses that rely primarily on consignment orders and eliminates duplicate or parallel processing steps. The integration ensures that distributed costs flow cleanly into ERP documents, maintaining profit center assignments and financial transparency

SAP Transportation Management now supports charge calculation and settlement at the consignment level, enabling more accurate cost allocation when multiple consignments are combined within a freight order. A consignment order groups transportation requirements such as freight units and products tied to specific pickup and delivery locations. The update allows freight orders to calculate charges individually per consignment or in consolidated form when consignments share the same supplier and source location. This is achieved through a new consignment resolution base, which can be assigned within calculation sheets alongside existing bases like route or product.

During charge calculation, the system can either compute charges separately for each consignment or merge them using charge type grouping to produce consolidated rate lines. Settlement behavior remains unchanged, with all calculated charges carried forward into the settlement document. Cost distribution has been enhanced to ensure charges linked to consignment-based resolution are distributed only to products that belong to the corresponding consignment. This applies to both direct and hierarchical distribution, producing accurate allocation documents and correct posting to expense or material accounts. Demonstrations showed both non-grouped and grouped scenarios, confirming consistent charge calculation, distribution logic, and settlement flow.

 

AI-Assisted Goods Receipt Analysis with Bordero Documents

SAPâ€™s AI-assisted Goods Receipt Analysis continues to evolve, expanding capabilities first introduced in 2023. Originally focused on extracting data from delivery notes and shipping documents to create consignment orders, the solution now adds support for the more complex bordero documentâ€”critical for gaining a full picture of incoming truckloads when EDI messages are missing or incomplete.

 Transfer of printed information to TM execution document using AI

In many real-world scenarios, trucks arrive at the gate before any system documents exist. The new bordero-based process solves this gap by allowing users to upload scanned carrier documents, which SAP Doc Services then classify and extract using AI. The system identifies carrier details, embedded shipping documents or delivery notes, and all cargo items, mapping them directly to freight orders, consignments, and product items in Transportation Management. This provides immediate visibility into what the truck is carrying and enables downstream processing such as check-in, warehouse handling, and goods receipt.

The S/4HANA 2025 FP01 update also introduces improved error handling. Users can now resolve common extraction issuesâ€”such as missing bordero IDs, undetermined suppliers, or mismatched shipping documentsâ€”through guided correction actions. A new drag-and-drop upload interface further speeds up document submission across consignment orders and freight orders.

Together, these enhancements significantly reduce manual effort, increase processing accuracy, and shorten turnaround time at the gate and in the warehouse. The result is a more resilient inbound logistics process, even when digital integration with suppliers and carriers is incomplete.


These are the main innovations in TM for FP01.
FP02 development is ongoing.
If you are curious about what will be delivered, check the items published on the Roadmap Explorer already now.

We have also scheduled  some enablement sessions for TM and the features delivered with FP01.
You can register with the following link to the sessions: Supply Chain Management webinars 

For more information, please visit the following sections:

  • Whatâ€™s New Viewer
  • SAP TM Product Page on sap.com
  • SAP Community for Transportation Management
  • SAP Transportation Management Group on LinkedIn

entry.title: Watch the recordings of our SAP Cloud ERP 2602 Early Release Series!
entry.content:
SAP Business Suite empowers organizations to scale, innovate, and adapt faster than ever. SAP cloud ERP applications, SAP Business AI, and SAP Business Data Cloud come together to deliver exceptional business valueâ€“all powered by SAP Business Technology Platform.

The SAP Cloud ERP Early Release Series is a biannual event showcasing live sessions led by product experts. These sessions provide an exclusive preview of upcoming innovations, including AI-driven features and advancements with Joule, tailored to selected lines of business and industries. Spanning several days, the series offers expert demos, insider previews, and real-time Q&A, giving participants a first look at exciting updates and the opportunity to get their questions answered directly.

From January 12 to January 16, 2026, we hosted 22 expert-led live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the 2602 release of SAP Cloud ERP. Missed the live sessions? No problem! Watch the replays on demand.

Sign-up instructions:

An active SAP Learning Hub license is required to consume the recordings. Find out how to sign up

As a customer:

Access to at least the SAP Enterprise Support Edition is required. Follow these steps to sign up:

  1. Navigate to the sign-up page and click on the â€œsign upâ€ button.

As a partner:
